_comment1: These are the address and port of the backend server, i.e. the server run by the Olympus dll mod.
_comment2: localhost should be used if the backend is running on the same machine as the frontend server, which is usually the case.
_comment3: If a direct connection is desired, e.g. for API usage, use '*' as address.
_comment4: The desired port should be available and not used by other processes.
_comment5: These are the sha256 hashed passwords for the game master, the two commanders, and the admin. They are used to authenticate the users.
_comment6: These are the settings for the frontend server, i.e. the server which hosts the Olympus GUI web interface.
_comment7: The port should be available and not used by other processes and is used to load the interface.

frontend._comment8: These are the custom headers used for authentication. They are used to authenticate the users and skip the login page
frontend._comment9: If enabled, the frontend server will look for the specified headers in the request and use them to authenticate the user.
frontend._comment10: The username header should contain the username and the group header should contain the group of the user.
frontend._comment11: If the headers are not present or the user is not authenticated, the user will be redirected to the login page.
frontend._comment12: This is useful for integrating Olympus with other systems, e.g. a SSO provider
frontend._comment13: The group should be one of the groups defined using the admin page on the web interface
frontend._comment14: If the user is by default authorized to more than one command mode, x-command-mode header can be used to specify the default command mode
frontend._comment15: Otherwise, the login page will be skipped, but a command more selection page will still be shown
frontend._comment16: The elevation provider is used to fetch elevation data for the map. It should be a URL with {lat} and {lng} placeholders.
frontend._comment17: These are the map layers used by the frontend server. They are used to display the map in the interface.
frontend._comment18: The urlTemplate should be a URL with {z}, {x}, and {y} placeholders for the zoom level and tile coordinates.
frontend._comment19: The minZoom and maxZoom define the zoom levels at which the layer is visible.
frontend._comment20: The attribution is the text displayed in the bottom right corner of the map.

frontend._comment21: These are the map mirrors used by the frontend server. They are used to load the map tiles from different sources.
frontend._comment22: The key is the name of the mirror and the value is the URL of the mirror.
frontend._comment3: If autoconnectWhenLocal is true, the frontend server will automatically connect to the backend server when running on the same machine.
frontend._comment4: If a proxy is used, the proxyHeader should be set to the header used to forward the client IP address to the backend server.
frontend._comment5: This is useful when running the frontend server behind a reverse proxy, e.g. nginx, allowing to skip login when connecting locally but still authenticate when connecting remotely.

_comment23: These are the settings for the audio backend, i.e. the service which handles direct connection of Olympus to a SRS server.
_comment24: The SRSPort is the port used to connect to the SRS server and should be set to be the same as the value in SRS (5002 by default).
_comment25: The WSPort is the port used by the web interface to connect to the audio backend WebSocket. It should be available and not used by other processes.
_comment26: The WSEndpoint is the endpoint used by the web interface to connect to the audio backend WebSocket when using a reverse proxy. A websocket proxy should be set up to forward requests from this endpoint to WSPort.
